pr_title: Use File instead of String input parameters

timeline.message:
Use File instead of String input parameters

Currently downloadFile and uploadFile expect a String with the local
path for the source file and destination file respectively. To move us
closer to iOS and to simplify the iOS, use a File instead as the input
parameter.

timeline.bodyText: Can we kill the declaration on L96, now? Is String local still used?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: It isn't, I missed it. TIL: Analyze -> Run Inspection By Name... -> Unused Declarations!
replies.author: jpignata

timeline.bodyText:
This existed before this PR -- but just noting it since I saw it:
fileName is a weird name for the first argument, in these various calls to SynchronousStorage#uploadFile(String, File, StorageOptions). I think it should be named remoteKey, right?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: Cool. I thought perhaps there was a reason for this difference I was missing. Renamed.
replies.author: jpignata

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: The second parameter is actually a suffix, or file extension, so it's just creating an empty text file called {prefix}.{suffix}. RandomTempFile sounds better for upload tests, however for download tests we'd still like an empty file. (Narrator: Which he could accommodate using the default constructor on RandomTempFile.)
replies.author: jpignata

replies.bodyText: RandomTempFile also can throw an IOException, so instead I left the throws declaration on each @Test if it was the only one, if not I up-scoped to Exception. Let me know if you had something else in mind.
replies.author: jpignata
